title: Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Field Trips ART AND ESSAY CONTEST - Fourth graders from across the state are asked to submit an original essay or original drawing that answers the question, “Why is it important to protect the prairie, our history, and all of the National Parks?” There will be six winners - three in the artwork and three in the essay portions of the contest. Visit the page below (All Field Trips) to learn more.  All Field Trips        Art and Essay Contest Learn More     Curriculum Materials Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve has lesson plans for teachers of various grades. Lessons and activities may be used to supplement classroom instruction or to prepare for a visit to the preserve.  All Curriculum Materials       Lesson Plans Learn More     Field Trips Field trips to Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve include the following: *A 2-hour guided tour of the historic buildings and tallgrass prairie, Jr. Ranger Program, Leave No Trace Scavenger Hunt, "Looking Small...Thinking Big Activity", or an 1880s Spring Hill Ranch Living History program (upon staff availability). Please call ahead to 620-273-8494 (hit 0) and schedule a program or tour. All Field Trips       Field Trips to the Preserve Learn More     Traveling Trunks Learn about the natural and cultural features of the Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve by reserving one of our traveling trunks.
